newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Gambro to invest 10-12 bln Skr over 3 years-paper.
newsitem.headline: Gambro to invest 10-12 bln Skr over 3 years-paper.

text.p: Swedish medical technology group Gambro, held by Swedish investment group Incentive, will invest 10-12 billion crowns over three years, local daily Sydsvenska Dagbladet said on Thursday.

"Acquisitions and creation of own dialysis clinics as well as acquisitions of operations within cardiac care require between eight and 10 billion crowns," the newspaper said after an interview with Gambro chief executive Berthold Lindqvist.
"Another two billion crowns will be invested in the group's existing plants."
At the same time the group will save 200 million crowns annually over three years.

"Cost cutting of five to six percent annually should compensate for strong price pressure in the health care area and inflation," the daily said, adding that cost savings would not affect Swedish operations.
